channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for KS
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for KS

item.title: Report E-2024040104
item.description:
Report E-2024040104

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-09T15:11:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-12
  • City: WICHITA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 2-cups of Zinc Sulfate were released from one 2000-pound super sack due to a forklift accident. ERTS reviewed the SDS with terminal personnel who felt comfortable cleaning the release with the proper available PPE on-site. the waste was placed into a 5-gallon metal drum. The super sack was placed into a yard box to continue transit.

item.title: Report X-2024040103
item.description:
Report X-2024040103

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-08T15:12:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-30
  • City: WICHITA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO UNLOAD DOOR 9. ONCE ON SCENE THE RESPONDER IN PROPER PPE CLEANED UP SPILL ACCORDING TO DECISION TREE AND RESPONCE SHEET. ONCE THE SPILL WAS CLEANED THE PACKAGE WAS TAKEN BACK TO THE HAZMAT AREA AND WAS PUT THROUGH THE DMP PROCESS FOR FLAMABLE LIQUID 3.

item.title: Report X-2024040100
item.description:
Report X-2024040100

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-08T15:12:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-29
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SUPERVISOR CALLED IN A LEAKER TO THE DMP. DMP DISPATCHED A RESPONDER WITH FULL PPE AND SPILL CART. RESPONDER ARRIVED ON SCENE AND FOUND THE LEAKING PACKAGE. RESPONDER CONSULTED WITH THE DECSION TREE ON HOW TO PROCEED WITH THE CLEAN UP. RESPONDER FOLLOWED GUIDLINES IN DECISION TREE AND CLEANED UP THE SPILL. RESPONDER BROUGHT BACK THE LEAKER TO DMP FOR PROPER DISPOAL. PACKAGE WAS PROPERLY DISPOSED OF.

item.title: Report X-2024040091
item.description:
Report X-2024040091

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-05T15:11:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-29
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER RESPONDED TO A PACKAGE IN THE UNLOAD WITH FULL PPE ON. USING THE DECISION TREE THE RESPONDED TO THE PACKAGE. THE RESPONDER PLACED ALL MATERIAL IN A LINED TUB AND TRANSPORTED THE MATERIAL TO DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. UPON ARRIVAL NOTED THAT ONE CARBON DIOXIDE FIRE EXTINGUISHER HAD A LOOSE PIN AND BROKEN SEAL. CLOSED THE VALVE AND REPLACED THE PIN. ALL MATERIAL WILL BE DISPOSED OF THOUGH OUTSIDE VENDOR.

item.title: Report E-2024040035
item.description:
Report E-2024040035

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-04T15:13:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-01
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XKC experienced a UN3266 Chemtreat FlexPro CL5793 release from a 275-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1 ounce of product released to the poly tote packaging only. The material was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one. The damaged tote was cut up and containerized along with oil dri and PPE into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024040044
item.description:
Report X-2024040044

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-04T15:13:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-27
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A RESPONDER RESPONDED TO A LEAKING PACKAGE IN THE UNLOAD WITH FULL PPE ON. USING THE DECISION TREE THE RESPONDER CLEANDED UP THE LEAKING PACKAGE AND PLACED ALL MATERIAL IN A LINED SPILL TUB. THE RESPONDER TRANSPORTED THE MATERIAL TO DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. UPON ARRIVAL NOTED THAT ONE 1 GALLON BOTTLE WAS CRACKED AND LEAKING. PAPER PACKING AT THE BOTTLE OF THE BOX BUT NO PACKING MATERIAL AROUND BOTTLE. ALL MATERIAL WAS DISPOSED OF THROUGH DMP.

item.title: Report X-2024040007
item.description:
Report X-2024040007

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-03T15:11:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-25
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: 1. X-2024040007 UNLOAD SUPERVISOR CALLED IN A LEAKER TO THE DMP. DMP DISPATCHED A RESPONDER TO THE LEAKER WITH FULL PPE AND SPILL CART. RESPONDER ARRIVED ON SCENE AND FOUND THE LEAKING PACKAGE. CONSULTED THE DECISOIN TREE ON HOW TO RESPOND TO THE LEAKER. FOLLOWING PROPER GUIDLINES IN THE BOOK THE RESPONDER CLEANED UP THE SPILL. RESPONDER BROUGHT BACK THE LEAKER AND ALL CONTAIMNATED BOXES TO DMP FOR PROPER DISPOSAL. 2. X-2024040008 UNLOAD SUPERVISOR CALLED A LEAKER TO THE DMP. DMP DISPATCHED A RESPONDER WITH FULL PPE AND SPILL CART. RESPONDER ARRIVED ON SCENCE AND FOUND THE LEAKER. RESPONDER CONSULTED WITH THE DECSION TREE ON HOW TO RESPOND TO THE LEAKER. RESPONDER FOLLOWED THE GUIDLINES IN THE DECSION TREE TO CLEAN UP THE LEAKER. RESPONDER BROUGHT BACK THE LEAKER AND CONTAIMINATED PACKAGES BACK TO THE DMP FOR PROPER DISPOSAL.
